intro: Chavica densa, commonly known as the dense chavica, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Chavica densa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
